task-stmt: What were the effects and official responses to the massive dust storms that hit the southern province of Sistan and Baluchistan and the city of Zabol in 2018?
task-narr: Massive dust storms have hit different parts of Iran, especially the southern part of Iran, including Kerman and Sistan and  Baluchistan states. Sistan and Baluchistan is not the only province to experience dust storms. In recent years, sand and dust storms in parts of southwestern Iran, including the oil rich province of Khuzestan, have caused periodic closures of schools, government offices, and businesses, bringing life to a standstill for residents. Many also fear the impact on their health.
task-in-scope: Documents may be relevant if they focus on the south part of Iran.
task-not-in-scope: Other cities, or other regions of Iran are not relevant.

spans.string: Head of the province’s Crisis Management Center Abdolrahman Shahnavazi

a4fa50db-0cbb-4087-b5ba-63e012564b9f.segment-text:
Dust storm hit several cities in northern part of Sistan-Baluchestan Province, which led to closure of schools and state organizations.
\r\n
\r\n\tHead of the province’s Crisis Management Center Abdolrahman Shahnavazi said on Saturday that the concentration of suspended particles in the province stands at 6,262 micrograms per cubic meter, which is forty-two times higher than the permitted limits.
\r\n
\r\n\tMore than 80 people were hospitalized on Saturday, suffering respiratory problems, Shahnavazi said.

spans.string: the provincial director general of disaster management
the southeastern province of Sistan and Baluchistan

98d88ce1-9731-45f7-b4c9-77e5c5a7f0d8.segment-text:
Iran\xe2\x80\x99s semi-official Mehr news agency says 95 people were taken to hospitals after suffering breathing problems during a sand-and-dust storm in the southeastern province of Sistan and Baluchistan.
\n
Tuesday\xe2\x80\x99s report quotes Abdolrahman Shahnavazi, the provincial director general of disaster management, as saying that 68 people were treated and released overnight while 27 remain hospitalized.
\n
Mehr says the sandstorm hit the province on Monday, with wind speeds of up to 115 kilometers per hour,

requests.req-text: How many people were hospitalized because of the dust storm?

spans.string: northern cities of Sistan and Baluchistan province

04a241ad-ee8f-4aa1-ae2e-d8ebdd87920b.segment-text: The concentration of suspended particles in the air reached 4,580 micrograms per cubic meter, 31 times beyond the permissible limit, in northern cities of Sistan and Baluchistan province, and air pollution has exacerbated in the region. Some 48 people were sent to hospitals and health centers on Sunday due to respiratory problems resulting from dust and sand storm.

d03451fe-4555-4fe3-94d4-d89871e0c49b.segment-text: More than 150 have been hospitalized for pulmonary complications and other medical issues resulting from a dust cloud that descended over Kerman and Sistan and Baluchistan in last few days.

requests.req-text: How did government officials respond following the dust storm?

cd573f9b-c440-46ec-8245-f48168041d61.segment-text: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said Mon. that his government is taking measures to increase power transfer with the region and other countries.

c3dc8e1a-deb3-45a9-a94e-9a22c901fcde.segment-text: Masoumeh Ebtekar, also warned of the deteriorating condition of some of the country\xe2\x80\x99s wetlands to dangerous levels and blamed Turkey for building too many dams.

task-stmt: Characterize the damage and resulting response to 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan.
task-narr: A large earthquake struck Japan in 2011 with a magnitude of 7.9 and a depth of up to 680 kilometers (423 miles), making it one of the deepest earthquakes of its scale. The Great Sendai Earthquake and Tsunami of 2011, also known as the Great Sendai Earthquake or the Great Tsunami Earthquake, struck northeastern Japan on March 11, 2011. The disaster started with a massive earthquake off the northeastern shore of Honshu, Japan's main island, which caused severe damage on land and triggered a series of enormous tsunami waves that wreaked havoc on many of the country's coastal towns, particularly in the Tohoku region in northeastern Honshu.
task-in-scope: Information about property damage, casualties, and deaths are relevant.
task-not-in-scope: Other earthquakes, or effects in other countries are not relevant.

spans.string: across the country\xe2\x80\x99s northeastern coastal areas

24df876c-28a8-4b75-8be2-2c08910d66e3.segment-text:
The shattering earthquake and tsunami that struck Japan on March 11 have wrought devastating physical damage \xe2\x80\x93 aggravated by the threat of a nuclear disaster \xe2\x80\x93 across the country\xe2\x80\x99s northeastern coastal areas, and have rekindled grave fears in the only country to have experienced fully the atom\xe2\x80\x99s potential for horror.
\r\n
Thousands of people are missing, hundreds of thousands have been displaced, and millions are without water, food, or heating in near-freezing temperatures. The death toll is expected to exceed 15,000.

31ced0cf-3a55-469b-8f3a-1a17211fc9b0.segment-text:
A 60-year-old man has been found on the roof of his floating house nearly 10 miles out at sea, two days after the tsunami that devastated the north-east coast of Japan .
Hiromitsu Shinkawa must have resigned himself to his fate when he was swept away by the retreating tsunami that roared ashore in his home town of Minami Soma in Fukushima prefecture.
As the wave approached, Shinkawa took the fateful decision to return home to collect belongings. Minutes later he was out at sea clinging to a piece of the roof from his own home.

requests.req-text: Did Japan receive any outside aid or assistance during the earthquake?

48a84d4e-dc7f-48df-aeba-5383048fc67b.segment-text: xe2\x80\x9cI lived in Japan for more than 30 years,\xe2\x80\x9d said village governor Meng. \xe2\x80\x9cDuring the Japan Tsunami Earthquake 2011, I saw the Japanese government imported shipping containers from China to build temporary houses for the survivors.

a9ef0e30-2fbb-4447-aef9-fc1520849a17.segment-text: Thousands of people are still unaccounted for, international help has arrived to help with the massive task of clearing up, industry is still crippled and the weather is poor.

requests.req-text: Which areas in Japan were most affected by the earthquake?

31945027-184f-4a8b-ae31-eb86aaf341b1.segment-text: Earthquake victims arrive at the closed former Kisai high school in Kazo, Saitama prefecture, on March 30, 2011.  Futaba-cho of  Fukushima prefecture near the earthquake temporarily moved their offices and escape facility to this high school.        UPI/Keizo Mori | License Photo

spans.string: head of the Disaster Management Division

0ee88da4-2eb8-4231-8241-2fb5fc4fadb2.segment-text:
Earthquakes are common in Japan, one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s most seismically active areas. Japan accounts for about 20 percent of the world\xe2\x80\x99s earthquakes of magnitude 6 or greater.
\n
The March 11, 2011, quake was magnitude 9, the strongest quake ever recorded in Japan.
\n
The massive tsunami it generated knocked out the Fukushima Daiichi plant, causing the worst nuclear crisis since Chernobyl a quarter of a century earlier.
\n
Warning systems have been updated since the 2011 disaster to spread warnings more quickly to the affected population, said Tsunetaka Omine, head of the Disaster Management Division in Iwaki, a city in Fukushima prefecture.

task-stmt: Find details about a devastating earthquake that shook Italy in August 2016, killing hundreds and destroying many buildings.
task-narr: An earthquake shook central Italy in August of 2016. The epicenter was reported at a depth of 10 kilometers and 66 kilometers from Perugia. Reports indicate that buildings were destroyed and people were trapped under the rubble and many were killed.
task-not-in-scope: Information about the October 2016 earthquake which occurred in the same region.

0e9ec6c4-3a24-4873-9461-c0a121374a99.segment-text: At least 290 people died in Wednesday’s (August 24) 6.2 magnitude earthquake which hit the regions of Lazio and Le Marche bordering Umbria.

31d0002a-82e5-4925-844c-5d22c93bd1c0.segment-text:
It was 3:36 a.m. when the 6.2 magnitude earthquake hit, followed by a succession of strong aftershocks \xe2\x80\x94 including one nearly as strong an hour later \xe2\x80\x94 that flattened houses and buried residents in the rubble.
Amatrice was the worst hit by the quake, which also damaged surrounding towns. As of Thursday morning, the deaths totaled 241, officials said.
\xe2\x80\x9cHalf the town no longer exists,\xe2\x80\x9d Mayor Sergio Pirozzi of Amatrice told reporters on Wednesday morning.

requests.req-text: When did the earthquake happen?

7d7c2d13-d6a7-42ac-8cce-fa254ab6eaea.segment-text:
24 Aug 2016
At least 38 people died in a powerful earthquake that hit central Italy early on Wednesday

4d56511f-c520-472a-9a04-fffeec81c5a5.segment-text: 250 people are now known to have died in the earthquake that hit central Italy on Wednesday

requests.req-text: What agencies and organizations responded following the quake?

280fe57b-7039-4f7f-9a75-c8399d5f7160.segment-text: The Italian Red Cross immediately mobilizing all its emergency centers and resources.

31d0002a-82e5-4925-844c-5d22c93bd1c0.segment-text: Rescue teams representing a spectrum of police and armed forces, local civil protection agencies from around the country, as well as medical staff members worked through the day searching for survivors, but more often finding the dead.

task-title: Rohingya Muslims fleeing violence in Myanmar
task-stmt: Identify the causes and resulting migration as thousands of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar have fled their country in the wake of violence.
task-narr: Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar have been persecuted for decades. They are the minority in a predominately Buddhist country and following attacks are fleeing Myanmar to neighboring cuntries. However, they are facing difficulties finding countries that will accept them.
task-in-scope: Muslim refugees fleeing violence in Myanmar.
task-not-in-scope: Other Muslim refugees in the same region.

3630007d-d0d5-4cb7-9460-0b2393dd9a11.segment-text: The refugees fleeing Myanmar , from the Muslim Rohingya ethnic minority

b953099d-38f2-48e3-97d0-39152ca74cbb.segment-text: Yet another deadly attack on Myanmar \xe2\x80\x98s persecuted Rohingya minority made the news recently, this time taking place in the village of Du Chee Ya Tan, Rakhine state, not far from the border with Bangladesh. It is the latest in a series of incidents over the past 18 months in which the nation\xe2\x80\x99s Muslim community in general, and the predominantly Muslim Rohingya in particular, have experienced violence at the hands of Buddhist mobs.

requests.req-text: Who are the refugees?

3630007d-d0d5-4cb7-9460-0b2393dd9a11.segment-text: The latest wave of migration is part of a huge exodus that began in the fall after the Myanmar government, which had long denied citizenship to the Rohingya, gave them a difficult choice

4a259dfb-c2fe-4687-938e-fac7a6ee7750.segment-text: For these men, ethnic Rohingya Muslim refugees from Myanmar, there is certainly nothing back across the water. Home doesn\xe2\x80\x99t exist anymore.

requests.req-text: How many refugees have left Myanmar?

2f94ee82-6b9f-4c1b-a081-565385459955.segment-text: more than 700,000 Rohingya have fled across the border from Rakhine State in Myanmar, after the army waged a brutal crackdown against the Muslim minority

eb16894e-3a7c-4505-bc31-5cc22fa20f8a.segment-text: More than 700,000 Rohingya fled to Bangladesh after an\xc2\xa0 army crackdown more than a year ago.

task-stmt: Find information about the 2017 floods and mudslides in northern Peru, how much damage they caused and how people were affected.
task-narr: In 2017 Peru experience one of the worst natural disasters in recent years. The country was hit by heavy rain that caused severe floods and mudslides.  More than 100,000 homes were demolished, many people became homeless, and some were killed.
task-in-scope: Effects of the event in Peru.
task-not-in-scope: Impacts on other South American countries are not relevant.

e2648c5a-09ab-4899-8b75-3100495599f6.segment-text:
A sudden and abnormal warming of Pacific waters off Peru has unleashed the deadliest downpours in decades, with landslides and raging rivers sweeping away people, clogging highways and destroying crops.
At least 62 people have died and more than 70,000 have become homeless as Peru’s rainy season has delivered 10 times as much rainfall than usual, authorities said Friday.

6eb31946-73ef-4f27-bdff-86ff2bd3ca07.segment-text: Peru needs more international aid to help hundreds of thousands of people cope with continuing floods and mudslides that have killed more than 100 people and torn apart much of the country’s infrastructure, the transportation minister said Friday.

requests.req-text: What are the areas of flooding?

805a134e-194e-4d79-adf1-7651921864a9.segment-text: parts of Peru and Chile - including the Atacama desert, one of the driest regions of the world.

0080c12b-6fb4-4c62-b766-13d16488a509.segment-text: Last month, a number of people died as the severe drought and wildfires gave way to torrential downpours and landslides. Floods clogged water treatment plants with rocks and debris, forcing authorities to restrict water use in Lima and Arequipa, Peru\xe2\x80\x99s second-biggest city.

requests.req-text: How many people are affected by the disaster?

608872fe-f995-49de-bea2-8c36aaeb7837.segment-text: With the Piura River overflowing, 200,000 Peruvians living downstream are in danger

e2648c5a-09ab-4899-8b75-3100495599f6.segment-text: At least 62 people have died and more than 70,000 have become homeless as Peru’s rainy season has delivered 10 times as much rainfall than usual, authorities said Friday.

task-stmt: Gather information about repeated outbreaks of dengue fever in southeast Asia since 2015.
task-narr: Dengue has been raging since 2015 in India, the Philippines, Taiwan, and other southeast Asian countries. About 2000 people were infected and handful died in these three countries alone. Healthcare professionals are advising people to remain vigilante to combat the disease by taking recommended heath measures including eliminating standing water near their homes.

spans.string: two of the most virulent strains of dengue

451e8ec7-1493-4e27-9dab-012e520b8e39.segment-text: A preliminary test report by AIIMS suggests two of the most virulent strains of dengue-type II and type IV-are circulating in Delhi this year.

spans.string: tens of millions across the globe

74a8be44-660c-49e1-aa1a-8a86d8c2dc78.segment-text: Dubbed "breakbone fever", dengue is one of the world\'s leading mosquito-borne illnesses and infects tens of millions across the globe annually. Around half of the planet\'s population live in at-risk areas, mainly in Latin America, Africa and Asia. Explosive outbreaks have ravaged Southeast Asia this year, infecting hundreds of thousands, killing hundreds, and crippling health care systems as governments struggle to contain the untreatable virus.

requests.req-text: What countries are seeing outbreaks of dengue?

spans.string: the new virus of an Asian genotype

4a69e153-da02-448f-b491-75a7fc854ce5.segment-text: A new dengue virus has been confirmed for the first time in the country. Scientists at Pune-based National Institute of Virology ( NIV ), who spotted it and had been tracking it, said the new virus of an Asian genotype (genetic structure) was a concern as it was associated with severe and extensive epidemics in Singapore in 2005 and Sri Lanka in 2009.

b763de4f-9b5b-4c29-ad45-b4c203031632.segment-text: The Philippines has ordered French drugmaker Sanofi to stop the sale, distribution and marketing of its Dengvaxia dengue vaccine in the country after the company last week warned it could worsen the disease in some cases.

requests.req-text: What is dengue? How is it transmitted? Is it treatable?

18e6ebda-e254-4061-8415-40e4db45c046.segment-text: Dengue is a mosquito-borne tropical disease that kills about 20,000 people a year and infects hundreds of millions.

74a8be44-660c-49e1-aa1a-8a86d8c2dc78.segment-text: The mosquitoes pick up the virus from infected humans -- even asymptomatic ones -- and pass it along to other people through bites.

task-stmt: Find details about the amount of damage and the government's response to flooding in western Iran in 2019, especially in Khuzestan province.
task-narr: There was a huge flood in western Iran in February 2019. I want to know how the government responded to it, which other organizations or countries helped Iran out and how many people were killed.
task-in-scope: Any rescue and assistance at this specific flooding and the degree of damages and casualties.
task-not-in-scope: Any other flood or any other natural disaster that happened in a different date and location other than west and southern Iran.

spans.string: the head of the emergency services

f467ded1-629b-4399-9aab-3cfa65533c7d.segment-text:
On Saturday April 6, Iran\'s oil-producing Khuzestan province was scrambling to evacuate many towns and villages as more rains and waters let out of dams threatened hundreds of thousands of people.
\n
Floods in Iran have killed 70 people since March 19, the head of the emergency services said on Friday according to the official IRNA News Agency.
\n
"The floods also injured 791 persons of which 45 are still hospitalized," Pir Hossein Koolivand told IRNA.

spans.string: residents of five districts of the southwestern city of Ahvaz

78762564-b491-4deb-96b2-d4942105ad18.segment-text: Iranian authorities have ordered residents of five districts of the southwestern city of Ahvaz to evacuate, as floodwaters entered Khuzestan Province\'s capital, local media report.\n\nProvincial Governor Gholamreza Shariati said on April 10 that the evacuation order was a "precautionary and preventive move to avert any danger," according to the semiofficial Tasnim news agency.

requests.req-text: Were any bridges damaged during the flood?

3e046193-4c2d-49c0-92c6-70297d7f4340.segment-text: Meanwhile, in Iranshahr, 11 bridges have been destroyed, the road to Bam is blocked, and floodwaters in Borazjan are creeping over the tops of vehicles, with all markets being closed.

4d82a4bd-db28-4718-a1e3-94a78bf54bcf.segment-text:
From mid-March to April, surging rivers burst their banks, sending an avalanche of floodwaters into villages and towns which killed at least 76 people and caused an estimated $2.5 billion in damage to roads, bridges, homes and farmland, according to Interior Minister Abdolreza Rahmani Fazli.
\r\n

requests.req-text: What kind of aids were delivered to people?

spans.string: IRGC Quds Force\xe2\x80\x99s Commander Maj. Gen. Ghasem Soleimani

15083e32-a4fe-4477-931e-4d63cf263630.segment-text:
IRGC Quds Force\xe2\x80\x99s Commander Maj. Gen. Ghasem Soleimani said \xe2\x80\x98mokeb\xe2\x80\x99 tents, used to serve the pilgrims of Imam Hossein (PBUH) during Arbaeen trek, will be settled in the flood-stricken regions of Iran to help the affected people.
\n

5b436cab-a1ee-46af-9b7b-005748b9fb4e.segment-text: The institute announced that it took delivery of the six-ton package which included 30 tents, 144 blankets, 10 sewage pumps, eight power generators as well as other items.

task-stmt: Find information about the extent of lives lost and infrastructure damaged due to the Haitian earthquake of 2010.
task-narr: In 2010 an earthquake with magnitude of 7 shattered Haiti and left more than 200,000 dead and countless damage in the poorest country of the western hemisphere.  The event devastated Haiti and presented enormous challenges to the international community who would be called to assist.
task-in-scope: Damage, people killed and injured by the earthquake, and the aid directed to Haiti after the quake.

e4c25216-a29d-4c9a-8770-04a2fc5aca23.segment-text: The 7.0-magnitude quake took 230,000 lives, injured more than 300,000 and left 1.3 million homeless.

991ee974-2ca8-4adb-84f4-6fb4e7e7396b.segment-text: Much of Haiti’s health infrastructure was shattered by the January 12 earthquake, which killed more than 250,000 people

requests.req-text: How many people died in 2010 earthquake?

47ba40c9-96bc-4a76-a442-9571e4cc5118.segment-text: We can speak today of more than 150,000 dead and that number will increase as relief efforts continue and more of the dead are found.

991ee974-2ca8-4adb-84f4-6fb4e7e7396b.segment-text: Much of Haiti’s health infrastructure was shattered by the January 12 earthquake, which killed more than 250,000 people

requests.req-text: Who provided aid to Haiti?

08484944-c99c-4ec1-b8e1-8bcf6e13f0e6.segment-text: In 2005, Jean established the Yele Haiti Foundation to provide humanitarian aid to the people of Haiti.

d2c5e205-7e72-4b8a-8f16-63a16a4a7b49.segment-text: Similarly, in his account of the \xe2\x80\x9crelief\xe2\x80\x9d that followed the Haitian earthquake of January 2010, Loewenstein argues that the people of Port-au-Prince were able to organise themselves to respond to the devastation \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x9cmakeshift clinics were established\xe2\x80\x9d, and \xe2\x80\x9cyoung men and women worked to clear the rubble with their bare hands\xe2\x80\x9d. After this, however, the international response was quickly monetised, or, to quote the typically direct words of then-US ambassador to Haiti, Kenneth Merten, \xe2\x80\x9cthe gold rush is on\xe2\x80\x9d.

task-stmt: In 2016, a large refugee camp in Calais was closed.  What caused the camp to be closed, and what was the impact on those who had been residing there?
task-narr: Calais Jungle was a refugee encampment in north of France sheltering more than 6,000 migrants. The camp was closed in 2016 and its residents were moved to 280 temporary reception centres around France.  The incident occurred amidst unprecedented migrations to Europe from the Middle East and Africa.
task-in-scope: Any refugees moving in or out of Calais.
task-not-in-scope: Conditions in the camp or incidents in the area after the camp's official closure in 2016.

8943c15e-d890-46c1-95ac-0cdb04a98083.segment-text: France is to gradually dismantle the \xe2\x80\x9cJungle\xe2\x80\x9d refugee camp in Calais , the interior minister, Bernard Cazeneuve, has vowed.

b906a4ff-ad29-4fe0-b93d-5455b133c7fd.segment-text: PARIS (Reuters) - French police removed thousands of migrants on Friday from a squalid camp in northeast Paris that had doubled in size after the closure last week of the “Jungle” camp in Calais.

requests.req-text: Which countries or regions did the refugees in Calais come from?

d8e209ad-9dfa-4c40-b520-a68307599405.segment-text:
Long before daybreak, the line began to form.  Hundreds of migrants, mainly from
Eritrea and Sudan ready for a fresh start.

e73ab6f6-121c-4884-92bd-7cf6cb01f5c7.segment-text: Most of the camp’s 2,000 residents \xe2\x80\x94 from Syria, Iraq, Kurdistan, Afghanistan and parts of Africa \xe2\x80\x94 entered Europe through Greece and trekked there by bus, train and walking.

requests.req-text: What was the refugees' ultimate destination?

d8e209ad-9dfa-4c40-b520-a68307599405.segment-text: Their dream had long been of the U.K.  It was a dream they had to leave behind as they left the "Jungle."

e73ab6f6-121c-4884-92bd-7cf6cb01f5c7.segment-text: On a trip to northern France last month, he explored \xe2\x80\x9cThe Jungle,\xe2\x80\x9d a migrants’ camp in Calais that has long been a gateway for desperate migrants trying to cross the channel illegally into England.

task-stmt: Find details about the Zika outbreak of 2016, including number of victims, vaccine development and countries involved.
task-narr: In 2015 there was an epidemic of Zika which started from Brazil and affected other countries in the Americas. Zika is a mosquito-borne disease that causes infant microcephaly. People infected with Zika can transmit the virus to their sexual partners.
task-in-scope: Any infection with Zika virus pertaining to 2015-2016 outbreak in any country.
task-not-in-scope: Any other infectious disease, or Zika outbreaks at any other time.

d296ec4b-a3d8-4234-9550-5922ca142288.segment-text: YANGON (Reuters) - A pregnant foreign woman in Myanmar’s largest city Yangon has been diagnosed with Zika, the first case of the mosquito-borne virus in the southeast Asian country, state-owned Myanmar TV (MRTV) said on Thursday.

f58b3391-3f40-467d-9f68-77d549681a6e.segment-text: In our health lead today, another baby born with Zika-related birth defects, this one a baby girl born in New Jersey.

requests.req-text: Which countries had cases of Zika?

f0b806c5-6f84-4a99-a925-721f9768e76d.segment-text: Zika virus emerged in northeast Brazil in 2015 and spread rapidly across the Americas, affecting populations that have been largely exposed to dengue virus.

5e68ce3b-ab73-4bc7-b397-d446e1860031.segment-text:
Two cases of the Zika virus have been confirmed in Australia . Officials said the two Sydney residents had recently returned from the Caribbean.
Zika has also been found in two unrelated cases in the Republic of Ireland , officials there said.

requests.req-text: In what non-pharmaceutical ways do countries fight the spread of Zika?

aa845396-592c-4219-b057-1031e54b871c.segment-text: In response, the city has stepped up its mosquito control and surveillance, and it will soon be starting a new public education campaign that will continue to highlight the risks posed by mosquitoes but with added emphasis on the risks of sexual transmission.

4fb0c1ef-0b2b-4400-94dd-b785189fce72.segment-text: Public outcry has also hampered what some experts believe is one of the best answers to a complicated problem \xe2\x80\x93 aerial spraying. Local resistance in Puerto Rico has so far stopped fumigation with a CDC recommended chemical called naled.
